column3: Greetings, traveler. I realize Amity is not the most well-known settlement, so feel free to ask any questions you might have.
What kind of place is this?
Oh, whatever's needed. Back in Eulmore, however, I used to work as a chef...right up until I made a dish which some free citizen deemed “bland and uninspired.”
The next thing I knew I was dumped outside with the scraps and left to rot. But I survived. And rumors of other survivors led me here to Amity.
I may have slipped from the lap of luxury, but naught compares to the freedom I feel now. No executioner's blade hanging over me every time I prepare a meal...
Those who know their history say this was once a thriving center for trade between Eulmore and the dwarves. But that was over a hundred years ago.
Whatever ties survived the Flood were later severed completely when Lord Vauthry came into power, and Amity was abandoned by both sides.

I'd be surprised if more than a handful of people below the Ladder even know this town exists anymore. Which, you have to admit, was the perfect situation for a collection of exiles and fugitives just looking to be left alone.
